title: The trouble with definitions: Why the SC halted UGC’s equity framework
description: The Supreme Court has put the UGC’s 2026 equity regulations on hold and revived the 2012 framework, flagging concerns that the new rules could create unequal access to grievance redressal. At the centre is Regulation 3(c), which defines “caste-based discrimination” only for SC/ST/OBC complainants. The case now tests how universities balance targeted protection with constitutional equality in remedies.

With Samson facing selection pressure due to recent form, this low-stakes T20I offers a chance for him to regain confidence amidst overwhelming home support before the World Cup.

title: Indonesian couple caned 140 times for breaking this Sharia law
description: In a stark display of Aceh's strict Sharia law, a couple endured 140 public canings each for extramarital sex and alcohol consumption. This severe punishment, witnessed by many, underscores the province's conservative Islamic regulations.  Even a Sharia police officer faced lashes for a similar offense, highlighting the unwavering enforcement of these codes.

title: 'I needed to let him go': Gabrielle Union on almost ending marriage with Dwyane Wade
description: Dwyane Wade and his wife, the popular actress Gabrielle Union, have had a beautiful and a healthy marriage ever since they tied the knot in 2014.While things have always been good between them, Gabrielle Union went through a traumatic struggles as she tried to conceive their baby early on in their marriage. Unfortunately, the popular actress went through a number of miscarriages and had to opt for surrogacy later. While the miscarriages affected her health, Gabrielle Union opened up how it changed her relationship with Dwyane Wade.

title: Google co-founder Sergey Brin makes his largest single public donation ever

The donation occurs as California billionaires prepare for a potential wealth tax initiative.
